alert.note: Alert for Carson; Gray; Roberts (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 04 at 1:10PM CDT until June 04 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Carson County in the Panhandle of Texas... Gray County in the Panhandle of Texas... Southern Roberts County in the Panhandle of Texas... * Until 515 PM CDT. * At 110 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to two inches of rain have already fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pampa, Miami, White Deer, Mclean, Groom, Lefors, Skellytown, Lake Mcclellan, Lora, Kingsmill, Alanreed and Codman. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
